OVERVIEW: The Spearhead series consists of deep, well drained soils that formed in colluvium from calcareous sedimentary or metamorphic rocks.  Spearhead soils are on steep to extremely steep mountain sides.  The average annual precipitation is about 35 inches.  The mean annual temperature is about 30 to 34 degrees F.

TAXONOMIC CLASS.content: TAXONOMIC CLASS: Loamy-skeletal, mixed, superactive Calcic Pachic Haplocryolls

TYPICAL PEDON.content:
TYPICAL PEDON:  Spearhead very gravelly loam-rangeland.  (Colors are for dry soil unless otherwise stated.)
Oi--1 to 0 inch; grass litter.
A--0 to 36 inches; dark brown (10YR 4/3) very gravelly loam, dark brown (10YR 3/3) moist; weak coarse subangular blocky structure parting to moderate fine granular; slightly hard, very friable, slightly sticky and slightly plastic; 30 percent pebbles and 10 percent cobbles; mildly alkaline (pH 7.6); gradual wavy boundary.  (16 to 40 inches thick)
Bk--36 to 60 inches; very pale brown (10YR 7/3) extremely cobbly sandy loam, brown (10YR 5/3) moist; weak fine granular structure; slightly hard, very friable, slightly sticky; 45 percent pebbles, 30 percent cobbles; strongly calcareous; moderately alkaline (pH 8.2).

TYPE LOCATION.content: TYPE LOCATION:  Teton County, Wyoming; in unsectionized area.  Photo 1-169.

RANGE IN CHARACTERISTICS.content:
RANGE IN CHARACTERISTICS:  The mollic epipedon is 16 to 40 inches thick.  Depth to uniformly calcareous material is 16 to 40 inches.  The mean annual soil temperature is 32 to 36 degrees F.  The mean summer temperature is 40 to 45 degrees F.  The control section is loam or sandy loam and has 20 to 45 percent gravel and 15 to 30 percent cobbles.  It averages less than 18 percent clay.
The A horizon has hue of 10YR or 7.5YR, value of 4 or 5 dry and 2 or 3 moist, and chroma of 2 or 3.  It is very gravelly loam.  This horizon is neutral or mildly alkaline.
The C or Bk horizon has hue of 10YR or 7.5YR, value of 5 through 7 dry and 4 through 6 moist, and chroma of 2 or 3.  It is moderately or strongly alkaline.  It has 1 to 14 percent calcium carbonate equivalent.

COMPETING SERIES.content:
COMPETING SERIES:  These are the Behanin, Blanca, Caballo, Campone, Croesus, Dateman, Ence, Gateview, Hapgood, Harcany, Hobacker, Lolan, Marcetta, Nagitsy, Nazaton, Nevtah, Poleline, 2 - Spearhead Series
Prong, and Snag series.  Behanin, Blanca, Campone, Ence, Gateview, Hapgood, Harcany, Lolan, Marcetta, Nazaton, Poleline and Snag soils are noncalcareous.  Caballo, Croesus, Dateman, Nagitsy, Nevtah, and Prong soils have bedrock at a depth of less than 40 inches.  Hobacker soils have extremely gravelly loamy sand or sand horizon within a depth of 40 inches.

GEOGRAPHIC SETTING.content: GEOGRAPHIC SETTING:  Spearhead soils are on mountain sides.  Slopes are 0 to 70 percent.  The soils formed in material weathered from calcareous sedimentary and metamorphic rocks.  Elevation is 7,000 to 11,000 feet.  The mean annual precipitation is about 30 to 45 inches.  The mean annual temperature is about 30 to 34 degrees F.  The frost-free season is less than 60 days.

GEOGRAPHICALLY ASSOCIATED SOILS.content: GEOGRAPHICALLY ASSOCIATED SOILS:  THESE ARE THE Midfork and Starman soils.  Midfork soils have a mollic epipedon less than 16 inches thick.  Starman soils lack a mollic epipedon and have bedrock at a depth of less than 20 inches.

DRAINAGE AND PERMEABILITY.content: DRAINAGE AND PERMEABILITY:  Well drained; moderate to rapid runoff; moderately rapid permeability.

USE AND VEGETATION.content: USE AND VEGETATION:  These soils are used for recreation and wildlife habitat.  Native vegetation is widely spaced Englemann spruce, alpine fir, wild geranium, lupine, parsley, and slender wheatgrass.

DISTRIBUTION AND EXTENT.content: DISTRIBUTION AND EXTENT:  In the mountains of western Wyoming.  The series is of small extent.

REGIONAL OFFICE.section: MLRA SOIL SURVEY REGIONAL OFFICE (MO) RESPONSIBLE
REGIONAL OFFICE.content: MLRA SOIL SURVEY REGIONAL OFFICE (MO) RESPONSIBLE: Bozeman, Montana

ORIGIN.content:
SERIES ESTABLISHED:  Teton County, Wyoming, Grand Teton National Park Area; 1976.
National Cooperative Soil Survey
U.S.A.

HORIZONS.name: A
HORIZONS.narrative: A--0 to 36 inches; dark brown (10YR 4/3) very gravelly loam, dark brown (10YR 3/3) moist; weak coarse subangular blocky structure parting to moderate fine granular; slightly hard, very friable, slightly sticky and slightly plastic; 30 percent pebbles and 10 percent cobbles; mildly alkaline (pH 7.6); gradual wavy boundary.  (16 to 40 inches thick)

HORIZONS.name: Bk
HORIZONS.narrative: Bk--36 to 60 inches; very pale brown (10YR 7/3) extremely cobbly sandy loam, brown (10YR 5/3) moist; weak fine granular structure; slightly hard, very friable, slightly sticky; 45 percent pebbles, 30 percent cobbles; strongly calcareous; moderately alkaline (pH 8.2).
